channel.title: F5 Labs All
channel.description: RSS for all F5 Labs content.

item.title: How We Handle Privacy at F5 Labs
item.description: Managing online privacy is a balancing act for both users and security professionals. We can do better than simply following privacy regulations such as the GDPR and CPRA.

item.title: Cybersecurity Predictions for 2022 from F5 Labs (and Friends)
item.description: We asked a diverse group of F5 security experts about cybersecurity in 2022. Here&rsquo;s what they said. We look at cyber-war, cyber-crime, the cloud, the supply chain, encryption keys, and new ransomware targets.

item.title: FluBot’s Authors Employ Creative and Sophisticated Techniques to Achieve Their Goals in Version 5.0 and Beyond
item.description: A deconstruction of FluBot 5.0&rsquo;s new communication protocol and other capabilities FluBot uses to hide, making it difficult for researchers and security solutions to detect.

item.title: Single Points of Failure in an Interconnected World
item.description: Moving to the cloud has benefits, but it must be balanced against the likelihood of outages in single-provider environments.

item.title: Log4Shell: Rebooting (The Same Old) Security Principles In its Wake
item.description: It can be easy to give in to frustration and pessimism during catastrophic events. But there are signs that not all is lost, even in the world of software dependencies.

item.title: Holiday Phishing Trends For 2021
item.description: As Christmas quickly approaches, seasonal phishing trends once again show that attackers are taking advantage of increased online shopping. Fraudsters doubled their efforts in November attacking ecommerce giants such as Amazon. The real attacker focus, however, was cryptocurrency with fraudulent sites...

item.title: Explaining the Widespread log4j Vulnerability
item.description: The log4j security vulnerability is one of the most widespread cybersecurity vulnerabilities in recent years. Here's a non-technical explanation of it.

item.title: How Global Cyberthreats Changed Over 2021
item.description: Scans continue against remote logins like VNC, RDP, and SSH, as well as MySQL and Elasticsearch. And what&rsquo;s going on in Malaysia and Lithuania?

item.title: The Ins and Outs of Digital Fraud
item.description: Retail fraud, identity theft, account takeovers, stolen payment cards&mdash;it feels like digital fraud is everywhere. Understand it better to fight it more effectively.

item.title: What is Multi-Cloud and How Does It Affect Security?
item.description: A look at multi-cloud security strategies, including the emerging practices of omni-cloud, Functions as a Service, Containers as a Service, cloud security posture management, and data sovereignty.

item.title: The 2021 TLS Telemetry Report
item.description: Creating an encrypted HTTPS website depends on a lot more than simply throwing a digital certificate at it and hoping for the best. In fact, Transport Layer Security (TLS) and HTTPS misconfigurations are now so commonplace that in the 2021 OWASP Top 10, Cryptographic Failures now comes in second place....

item.title: Prioritizing Vulnerability Management Using Machine Learning
item.description: Using a few free web sources and a spreadsheet, security teams can use machine learning to quickly predict which critical vulnerabilities will be exploited.

item.title: BGP, DNS, and the Fragility of our Critical Systems
item.description: DNS is better known, but some recent high-profile outages are a reminder that Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) failures can take sites down too.

item.title: Protecting Critical Systems with Isolation and Jump Boxes
item.description: Managing hardened systems without exposing them to unwanted attack vectors is difficult. Jump boxes are one way to do it&mdash;learn why and how.

item.title: Cyberattacks Targeting South Africa, January through June 2021
item.description: South Africa&rsquo;s cyberattack landscape saw targeting of Scryba, PHP, and CVE-2017-9841 web vulnerabilities.

item.title: DDoS Against a Financial Service: Analysis of a Massive Attack
item.description: A detailed look at an 840-Gbps DDoS attack on a financial services provider and a deeper dive into attacking nodes.

item.title: Fraud Scenarios in the Buy Now, Pay Later Ecosystem
item.description: Existing fraud tricks are finding new use in buy now, pay later payment systems.

item.title: Cybersecurity Controls to Stop Ransomware
item.description: Stopping ransomware takes work&mdash;F5 looks at the defense techniques of user account management, network segmentation, and data backup.

item.title: The State of the State of Application Exploits in Security Incidents
item.description: The title of this report is not a typo. &ldquo;The State of the State of Application Exploits in Security Incidents&rdquo; is a meta-analysis of several prominent industry reports, each of which covers the state of application security.

item.title: What Is mTLS?
item.description: Mutual Transport Layer Security (mTLS) allows two parties to authenticate each other during the initial connection of an SSL/TLS handshake.

item.title: Cybersecurity Compliance Failures in Financial Services
item.description: Examining three breach and compliance failure cases under the New York Department of Financial Services&rsquo; 23 NYCRR Part 500 cybersecurity regulation.

item.description: A detailed examination of application risk and cybersecurity attack chains, broken down by sector.

item.title: Attacker Tricks for Taking Over Risk-Based Multifactor Authentication
item.description: From spoofing device fingerprints to hijacking authenticated sessions, attackers use a range of techniques to bypass multifactor authentication.

item.title: MITRE ATT&CK: What It Is, How it Works, Who Uses It and Why
item.description: MITRE ATT&amp;CK, a framework that uniquely describes cyberattacks from the attacker&rsquo;s perspective, is quickly being adopted by organizations worldwide as a tool for analyzing threats and improving security defenses.

item.title: Cyberattacks at Banks and Financial Services Organizations, and a Look at Open Banking
item.description: A review of 2018-2020 cyberattacks at brokerages, investment funds, payment processors, and financial services organizations as well as API security incidents and open banking.

item.title: Cyberattacks at Banks and Financial Services Organizations
item.description: A look at cybersecurity incidents at banks, credit unions, insurance companies, government-sponsored financial institutions, and stock exchanges.

item.description: The 2021 version of F5&rsquo;s continuing analysis of the application security threat landscape explores ransomware, payment card theft, and account takeover.

item.description: A behind-the-scenes peek into the hidden world of human click farms.

item.description: Even with 99.95% efficacy of network security controls, bad actors can still monetize fraud. Security convergence is the way forward in surviving digital fraud.

item.description: Three years of reported security incidents shows continued growth in denial-of-service and password login attacks such as brute force and credential stuffing.

item.title: When Will We Get Rid Of Passwords?
item.description: Passwords are inherently flawed, and not just because of credential stuffing. The future of authentication looks very different, but there are steps you can take now to control risk.

item.title: IcedID Banking Trojan Uses COVID-19 Pandemic to Lure New Victims
item.description: TA551 (AKA Shathak) deploys the IcedID banking trojan using COVID-19 in Microsoft Word documents containing a malicious macro that drops an installer.

item.title: Threats, Vulnerabilities, Exploits and Their Relationship to Risk
item.description: Security threats and vulnerabilities constitute risk when both likelihood and impact are high.

item.description: Using Zero Trust for Microservices with DevSecOps: Advice from USAF&rsquo;s Nicolas Chaillan

item.description: India&rsquo;s attack landscape saw focus on Port 5900 and the highest number of scans from the UK.

item.title: 2021 Credential Stuffing Report

This report is a comprehensive examination of the entire life cycle of stolen credentials&mdash;from their theft, to their resale, and their repeated use in credential stuffing attacks.

item.description: A detailed look at the cybersecurity threats to the COVID-19 vaccine rollout pipeline

item.title: F5 Labs’ Cybersecurity Predictions for 2021

item.description: AI and Machine Learning can find the optimal cyberattack strategy by analyzing all possible vectors of attack.
